funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: Rural Development funds will be used to help Dogwood Farms install a 288 kilowatt (kW) solar array. Dogwood Farms is a family-owned crop farming operation that produces corn, soybeans, and wheat in the rural community of Carter Township, Arkansas. This project is expected to save $32,675 annually and generate 403,400 kilowatt hours (kWh) (99 percent of the companys energy usage) per year, which is enough to power 37 homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND.ENERGY EFFIC IMPROV GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
naics_description: APPAREL ACCESSORIES AND OTHER APPAREL MANUFACTURING
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install LED lighting and attic insulation to make energy efficiency improvements for a commericial manufacturing facility. Kerusso Activewear Inc., in Berryville, Ark., specializes in screen-printing textiles, T-shirts and sweatshirts. It will save $3,439 per year and will replace 24,908 kWh (41.37 percent) annually. The purpose of this funding program is to assist farmers, ranchers, and rural small businesses in developing renewable energy systems, and in making energy-efficiency improvements to its operations.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY DELTA HEALTH CARE GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: Rural Development funds will be used to help a consortium consisting of Arkansas Rural Health Partnership, University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences, and Jefferson Regional School of Nursing establish a Food as Medicine program. The program will establish two food pharmacies located in the Arkansas cities of Lake Village and Helena. The program will provide nutritional and health coaching, cooking classes, and provide healthy food to seniors (65+) who are experiencing food insecurity, have chronic disease, and have been selected to participate in the program.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: Rural Development funds will be used to help Scott George Farms install a 141.3 kilowatt (kW) solar array. Scott George, an agricultural producer of corn and soybeans in Corning, Arkansas, expects to save $24,924 per year. The project will generate 216,700 kilowatt hours (kWh) (100 percent of the operations energy usage) annually, which is enough energy to power 20 homes.

funding_code: ECONOMIC IMPACT INITIATIVE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide grant funding which will allow the City to purchase a new fire truck for the City Fire Department in order to help provide more reliable first responder and public protection services to residents of the City of Piggott. Additional funding includes $14,806 in Applicant Contribution for a Total Project Cost of $32,806.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to replace the upper roof of the courthouse to eliminate leaks in order to help provide better public services to area rural residents.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to make improvements to the existing wastewater treatment facility. These improvements will consist of replacing the lagoon discharge control valve, post-aeration equipment, rehabilitation of the intermittent sand filters and installation of a new tablet feed chlorinator. The rehabilitation will include the removal of all of the existing distribution piping, filter media and collection piping. This rehabilitation will provide for the proper filtration that is needed after the facultative lagoons and maintain compliance with its existing National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) permit limits while discharging.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to make improvements to the existing wastewater treatment facility. These improvements will consist of replacing the lagoon discharge control valve, post-aeration equipment, rehabilitation of the intermittent sand filters and installation of a new tablet feed chlorinator. The rehabilitation will include the removal of all of the existing distribution piping, filter media and collection piping. This rehabilitation will provide for the proper filtration that is needed after the facultative lagoons and maintain compliance with its existing National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) permit limits while discharging.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Retail Trade (44-45)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install a 36.21 kW solar array on the rooftop of a locally-owned builders supply business in Fordyce, Ark. Holt Builders Supply Inc. will save $3,894 per year and replace 47,490 kWh (91 percent) annually. The purpose of this funding program is to assist farmers, ranchers, and rural small businesses in developing renewable energy systems, and in making energy-efficiency improvements toits operations.

program: Rural Economic Development Loan and Grant (REDLG)
funding_code: RURAL ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT LOANS (ELECTRIC)
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help North Arkansas Electric Cooperative, Inc. relend loan funds to Fulton County Hospital in Salem, Arkansas. The hospital will utilize the loan funds to purchase two new ambulances, and to upgrade their HVAC system.

funding_code: ECONOMIC IMPACT INITIATIVE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase an upgraded phone system for the hospital and to make needed hospital parking lot improvements. Additional funding includes $43,000 in applicant contribution for a total project cost of $65,000.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide grant funding for the county to purchase two roof top compressors for the HVAC as only four of the six compressors are currently working for the existing Fulton County Hospital. This will enable the county to help provide more reliable and safe public services to area rural residents.

funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
naics_description: BROILERS AND OTHER MEAT TYPE CHICKEN PRODUCTION
project_announced_description: Rural Development funds will be used to help Ronny Branscum install a 149.5 kilowatt (kW) roof-mounted solar system on six broiler barns. Branscum, an agricultural producer in Pineville, Arkansas, is expected to save $19,643 annually. This project will generate 211,870 kilowatt hours (kWh) of energy per year(100 percent of producers energy use), which is enough to power 19 homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND.ENERGY EFFIC IMPROV GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to make energy efficiency improvements with the purchase and installation of a new grain drying system for six grain bins used by Cox Pirani Farms, a row crop farming operation in Osceola, Ark. This project will save $9,107 per year and will replace 142,435 kWh (32 percent) per year, which is enough energy to power 13 homes.The purpose of this funding program is to assist farmers, ranchers, and rural small businesses in developing renewable energy systems, and in making energy efficiency improvements toits operations.

naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: Rural Development funds will be used to help a 160-pond aquaculture operation in Brinkley, Arkansasinstall an oxygen monitoring system for their pond aeration systems. Dunns Fish Farms Inc., which grows largemouth bass primarily for live food markets, expects to save $62,809 and 1,053,050 kilowatt (kW) hours (thirty-five percent of the companys energy usage) per year. This is enough energy to power 97 homes.

funding_code: SECTION 306 FFB - OTHER ELECTRIC FFB - OTHER LOAN PERSISTENT POVERTY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to connect 1,692 consumers, and build and improve 156 miles of line. The loan includes $3.8 million in Smart Grid funding to install 122 miles of overhead fiber-optic communication lines and substation fiber-optic backbone. Petit Jean is headquartered in Clinton, Ark. It serves 20,200 customers over 3,500 miles of line in nine counties in Arkansas.

funding_code: TELEMEDICINE- GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to improve a data center at the hub site in Franklin to make it a reliable platform for a telemedicine system to deliver medical and behavioral services. Many of the services will focus on medication-assisted treatment of opioid substance use disorders in nine rural counties in northwest Arkansas. Laptops, workstations and telemedicine carts with peripheral health diagnostic devices will enable a patient in a facility at one hub/end-user site to be examined remotely by a health care staff member at another hub/end-user site. In addition, equipment for remote monitoring of diabetic patients in their homes will permit more timely care for those patients.

funding_code: DLT GRANTS - CARES ACT - EDUCATIONAL
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to implement a distance learning system with virtual reality welding simulators at five rural sites in Sevier, Little River and Howard counties. The system will allow Cossatot Community College to offer distance learning skilled sciences courses to additional rural students at multiple locations. The grant will fund network fiber upgrades at Cossatots Lockesburg campus . The college expects to train 30 students in welding technology at five end-user sites annually. The equipment also will be available for special training sessions in evenings and on weekends for workers and industry partners.

funding_code: TELEMEDICINE- GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide telehealth services from one hub site to six rural hub/end-user sites. Specialists from Conway Regional Medical Center will connect on consults with outreach sites in Telehealth Huddle Rooms which are equipped with video-conferencing equipment that will allow them to work with a patient on a remote site, review images accessed and sent from a remote site. The proposed project seeks to address these challenges by increasing the capability of the Conway Regional Medical Center to focus on providing faster and more targeted Pain Management, Cardiology, 0rthopedics, General Surgery and OB/Gyn services. This project provides six rural Central Arkansas communities with telehealth services, that would serve 25,473 rural residents.

borrower_name: Div. of Agriculture Univ. of Arkansas
funding_code: DISTANCE LEARNING- GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase distance learning equipment that would allow Division of Agriculture of the University of Arkansas (UADA) Cooperative Extension Service (CES) to install cellular routers with WIFI to 51 geographic locations throughout Arkansas. These devices will improve internet connectivity and provide an internet access point "parking lot hotspot" for clientele to access research-based training. The proposal would also allow UADA to install video conferencing hardware in these locations to reach an estimated minimum audience of 9,000 per year.

funding_code: DLT GRANTS - SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER - EDUCATIONAL
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Lyon College to purchase interactive video conferencing equipment that will provide distance learning services for approximately 3,200 rural high school and middle school students. This project will provide expanded educational opportunities to include science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM) for rural Arkansas high schools, expanded post-secondary readiness, transition, and enrollment programs, substance abuse educational and counseling support for students, health education, and professional development and instructional resources for teachers and school leaders through distance learning.

borrower_name: University of Arkansas for Medical Scien
funding_code: TELEMEDICINE- GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to bring telemedicine across rural Arkansas through the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences. This project will place new telemedicine carts at rural hospitals, rural health clinics, and rural penitentiaries through Arkansas for the purposes of clinical care. Most sites are current telemedicine users with outdated equipment at risk of technical failure and require replacement for continued program operation. With 36 sites around the state, this project will benefit over 811,000 residents.

project_name: Irons Fork Water Treatment Plant Improvement Project
funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to make improvements to the citys water treatment plant. These improvements will consist of replacing the existing clearwell and high service pump station as well as upgrades to the controls and electrical systems at the raw water pump station, replacement of the two existing solids contact clarifier mechanisms as well as other water treatment plant improvements. These water treatment plant improvements will provide area residents with a more reliable public water supply.

project_name: Irons Fork Water Treatment Plant Improvement Project
funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to make improvements to the citys water treatment plant. These improvements will consist of replacing the existing clearwell and high service pump station as well as upgrades to the controls and electrical systems at the raw water pump station, replacement of the two existing solids contact clarifier mechanisms as well as other water treatment plant improvements. These water treatment plant improvements will provide area residents with a more reliable public water supply.

funding_code: VALUE-ADDED PRODUCER DVLP GRANTS-DISCR
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Ralston Family Farms LLC with working capital to market a new product. Ralston Family Farms LLC, a family-owned agricultural operation in Atkins, Arkansas,uses rice that has been sustainably grown, harvested, and milled on their farm to produce their new rice grits product. Grant funds will be used for marketing the rice grits to potential retailers and food service distributors across the nation, distribution to new customers, and product packaging.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY DELTA HEALTH CARE GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Other Services (except Public Administration) (81)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help a consortium of Winrock International Institute for Agricultural Development, New York Institute of Technology, and Community Health Centers of Arkansas implement a two-year project that will address healthcare needs in four persistent poverty counties in Arkansas. The program will focus on employees and worksites as a target audience to directly address chronic disease burdens driven by social and economic determinants.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Winrock International Institute for Agricultural Development conduct a feasibility study to determine critical parameters for a new company that would service specialty crop producers and buyers in Arkansas. This project will concentrate on counties and communities along the Arkansas River Valley region, specifically economically suppressed communities in and around Logan, Scott, and Yell counties.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Arkansas Human Development Corporation provide training and technical assistance through three regional business development forums in rural Arkansas. Forums are designed to start new businesses and strengthen and/or expand existing businesses through job creation. This project will provide rural residents with resources such as how to obtain funding, how to develop business plans, and resources that can be used to start or expand businesses within the communities.

funding_code: RBCS DEVELOPMENT GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Arkansas Economic Development Commission offer training to targeted rural communities in Arkansas designed to empower community leadership on best practices for retail business attraction and retention.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing (53)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be usedto purchase and install a 44.6 kW rooftop solar array at Sunset Lodge, a locally-owned and operated event center in rural Pulaski County, Ark. This project will save $4,954 per year and replace 59,855 kWh annually. The purpose of this funding program is to assist farmers, ranchers, and rural small businesses in developing renewable energy systems, and in making energy-efficiency improvements toits operations.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
naics_description: BROILERS AND OTHER MEAT TYPE CHICKEN PRODUCTION
project_announced_description: Rural Development funds will be used to help David Rawls, an agricultural producer in Pocahontas, Arkansas install a 199.08 kilowatt (kW) roof-mounted solar system on six poultry barns. This project is expected to save $26,475 annually. It will generate 287,776 kilowatt hours (kWh) per year (92 percent of producers energy use), which is enough energy to power 26 homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing (53)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be usedtohelp ARSoft LLC, a locally-owned property management business in Pocahontas, Ark., install a 18.4 kilowatt rooftop solar array. This project is expected to save $3,242 per year, and replace 27,950 kilowatt hours (91 percent of the companys energy use) annually.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation (71)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 41.3 kW rooftop solar array. Black River Health Club is a locally-owned health and wellness gym in Pocahontas, Ark. This project will save $6,752 per year and will replace 51,234 kWh annually. The purpose of this funding program is to assist farmers, ranchers, and rural small businesses in developing renewable energy systems, and in making energy-efficiency improvements toits operations.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
naics_description: OFFICES OF PHYSICIANS (EXCEPT MENTAL HEALTH SPECIALISTS)
project_announced_description: Rural Development funds will be used to help Pocahontas Medical Clinic PA install a 155.5 kilowatt (kW) roof-mounted solar array on top of their building in Pocahontas, Arkansas. This locally-operated rural small business expects the solar project to save $29,958 per year, and replace 250,697 kilowatt hours (kWh) (100 percent of the companys energy usage) annually, which is enough energy to power 23 homes.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help East Arkansas Enterprise Community provide technical assistance and training to small business owners and entrepreneurs in the eastern Arkansas counties of Cross, Lee, Phillips, and St. Francis. program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND.ENERGY EFFIC IMPROV GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Jessland Plantation install two electric irrigation well motors. Jessland Plantation is a family-owned farming operation in Forrest City, Ark. that primarily produces cotton, peas, and beans. This project is expected to save $691 per year, and replace 43,963 kilowatt hours annually (66 percent of the companys energy use).

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Community Venture Foundation, dba Startup Junkie Foundation, implement an initiative that offers resiliency resources as well as events and consulting for both new and established businesses in rural communities within nine Arkansas counties.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Communities Unlimited Inc. provide customized and intensive business and management consulting services to rural businesses across 50 Arkansas counties with a focus on minority-owned businesses.

funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by Communities Unlimited (CU) to provide training and technical assistance to four low-income communities through their E.D.G.E. Capacity Building program to focus on building the capacity in areas of community and economic development. CU will work with two communities in Arkansas and two in Texas with the overall goal to builld local leadership capacity of rural and under-resourced areas so that they can move their communities toward sustainable prosperity.

funding_code: CF TAT GRANT (SECTION 6006)
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide training and technical assistance to a minimum of 40 communities in Alabama, Louisiana, Mississippi and Texas through their capacity building program in order to identify and plan for community facility needs. Communities Unlimited will address improving the quality of life and developing the rural economy with each of its recipient communities. Emphasis will be given to those communities of 2,500 or less population and with median household income of less than 60% of the State Non-Metropolitan Median Household Income levels.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY (GRANT ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide additional funding to make improvements to the citys existing water treatment facility. These improvements will include construction of a clarifier outside the existing facility. The clarifier will help to remove iron from the raw water before it reaches the gravity and filters. The project will also consist of an automatic ventilation system which will measure chlorine gas levels in the filter room and will control the air supply based on those levels. This project will provide the area rural residents with more reliable public health and safety services.

funding_code: GUARANTEED B&I 3% FEE LOAN
naics_industry_sector: Wholesale Trade (42)
naics_description: OTHER FARM PRODUCT RAW MATERIAL MERCHANT WHOLESALERS
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Riceland Seed Company dba Stratton Seed Company refinance maturing debt and provide permanent working capital. Stratton Seed Company is a family-owned agribusiness operation in rural Arkansas since 1948. This project will provide the company with a strong, stable base of funding that will enable them to: (a) sustain its recovery from the factors caused by the COVID Pandemic; (b) realize its growth plans; and (c) preserve and increase employment at its facilities.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: RENEWABLE ENERGY SYSTEMS GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Retail Trade (44-45)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Carter Building Supply Inc., a retail hardware business in DeWitt, Arkansas, install a 51.7 kilowatt (kW) solar array. The renewable energy project is expected to save $4,123 and generate 68,782 kilowatt hours (kWh) (100 percent of the businesss historic energy usage) annually, which is enough energy to power six homes.

project_name: Collection System and Wastewater Treatment Facility
funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used as additional funding to construct a public wastewater treatment facility and wastewater collection system that will serve residents of Alpena. Alpena currently does not have a wastewater collection system or wastewater treatment facility and the residents rely upon aging septic systems, which may not meet todays regulation standards.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Thomas Poole, an agricultural producer in Eudora, Arkansas, install a new 96-kilowatt (kW) solar system. This project is expected to save $12,353 and generate 142,865 kilowatt hours (kWh) annually (104 percent of the operations historic usage), which is enough energy to power 13 homes.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to allow the Dermott Clinic to install an emergency backup generator along with a total floor replacement. The emergency backup generator will enable the clinic to maintain the temperatures of COVID-19 vaccines during power outages and to store the back-up servers for the entire Mainline Health Systems multiple facilities. This will also provide better support to immediate health care needs, ensure the area is prepared for future pandemics and increase access to quality health care services to the rural area residents.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to demolish the existing Eudora clinic and reconstruct a facility on the existing site that will support immediate health care needs, provide COVID-19 vaccinations and testing, better prepare the area for future pandemics, and increase access to quality health care services to the areas citizens.

funding_code: CF 2019 DISASTER GRANT - TORNADOES FLOODS OTHER
naics_industry_sector: Wholesale Trade (42)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to enable this county-owned Critical Access Hospital to install a new electronic nurse call system along with new hospital beds, which are electronically compatible with the new system. The system will improve the care and safety for all patients. In addition, the project will include interior and exterior electronic security access doors for overall safety of both patients and hospital staff.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: RENEWABLE ENERGY SYSTEMS GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Chimney Rock Cattle Company, an agricultural producer specializing in beef cattle production, install a 112 kilowatt (kW) solar system in Concord, Arkansas. This project is expected to save $15,849 and generate 162,082 kilowatt hours (kWh) (92 percent of the business operations historic usage) annually, which is enough energy to power 15 homes.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help recover unreimbursed lost revenues experienced by the Baptist Health Heber Springs facility during the COVID-19 pandemic and will directly impact the health care services and improve community health outcomes.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used for water treatment plant expansion, a raw water pump station, converting filter control valves, sodium hypochlorite disinfection and secondary CT clear well improvements. The funds will also be used for the construction of a second water treatment process train that would increase the capacity of the water treatment plant to 2.0 MGD. The current treatment facility does not have treatment redundancy with its solids contact clarifier, CT clear well, or filter backwash pump, which does not allow for proper maintenance or repairs to facility. Without redundancy, the entire City and Rural Water Customers would be without treated water if a failure in facility operation occurred.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used for water treatment plant expansion, a raw water pump station, converting filter control valves, sodium hypochlorite disinfection and secondary CT clear well improvements. The funds will also be used for the construction of a second water treatment process train that would increase the capacity of the water treatment plant to 2.0 MGD. The current treatment facility does not have treatment redundancy with its solids contact clarifier, CT clear well, or filter backwash pump, which does not allow for proper maintenance or repairs to facility. Without redundancy, the entire City and Rural Water Customers would be without treated water if a failure in facility operation occurred.

naics_industry_sector: Other Services (except Public Administration) (81)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help German Auto Tech LLC install a 17.2 kilowatt solar system. This project is expected to save $3,070 per year and replace 23,740 kilowatt hours (70 percent of the companys energy usage) annually.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Helios Energy LLC install a 190.08 kilowatt (kW) solar array in Hot Springs, Arkansas. This project is expected to generate 269,235 kilowatt hours (kWh) and save $26,923 annually, which is enough energy to power 24 homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: RENEWABLE ENERGY SYSTEMS GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Retail Trade (44-45)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install a 120-kilowatt (kW) solar array at Alcora Corporation, a retail hardware operation doing business as Village True Value Home Center in Hot Springs Village, Arkansas. This project is expected to save $11,308 and generate 147,559 kilowatt hours (kWh) (104 percent of the businesss historic energy usage) annually, which is enough energy to power 13 homes.

funding_code: RBCS DEVELOPMENT GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Clarksville Connected Utilities in its community development endeavors. This project will leverage the ability of regional suppliers of poultry litter to provide renewable industrial feedstock to companies using technologies to produce bioenergy and bio-based products. This project will identify, rate, and strengthen feedstock supply chains to support new bio-based businesses and attract bio-based technologies that will positively impact the rural economy.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND.ENERGY EFFIC IMPROV GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Brice Farm LLC install a new grain monitoring system to existing storage bins. Brice Farm is an agricultural producer of rice and soybeans located in Lawrence County, Arkansas. This energy efficiency improvement project is expected to save $4,685 and 102,016 kilowatt hours (60 percent of the agricultural operations historic usage) annually, which is enough energy to power nine homes.

funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Wholesale Trade (42)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Emery Hughes Corporation, a family-owned business in England, Arkansas, install a 32 kilowatt (kW) solar array. This project is expected to save $4,656 and generate 47,991 kilowatt hours (kWh) (92 percent of the business operations historic usage) annually.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND.ENERGY EFFIC IMPROV GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Chris Isbell, a rice producer in England, Arkansas, install a grain monitoring system to the storage bins on his 3,000-acre farm. This energy efficiency improvement project is expected to save $4,332 and 93,346 kilowatt hours (36 percent of the agricultural operations historic usage) annually, which is enough energy to power 8 homes.

funding_code: ELEC SECTION 4 TREASURY RATE - PERSISTENT POVERTY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to connect 4,923 consumers and build and improve 360 miles of line. This loan includes $1,577,460 in smart grid technologies. Arkansas Valley Electric is headquartered in the city of Ozark, Arkansas serving an average of 61,397 consumers through 6,764 miles of line in ten counties in Arkansas and two counties in Oklahoma.

funding_code: ELEC SECTION 4 TREASURY RATE - PERSISTENT POVERTY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to connect 2,964 consumers and build and improve 331 miles of line. This loan includes various smart grid projects in the amount of $11,467,700 including the installation of 273 miles of fiber cable for the backbone communications network. C & L Electric is headquartered in Star City, Arkansas and provides service to an average of 22,549 consumers over 4,497 miles of line in eight Arkansas counties.

funding_code: ELEC SECTION 4 TREASURY RATE - PERSISTENT POVERTY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to finance the additions and modifications of distribution and transmission facilities that are required to adequately supply future peak loads, to conform to safety requirements, and to improve the quality and reliability of their service. KAMO is a generation and transmission cooperative headquartered in Vinita, Oklahoma, providing wholesale electric service to 17 electric distribution cooperatives in northeast Oklahoma and southwest Missouri.

funding_code: ELEC SECTION 4 TREASURY RATE - PERSISTENT POVERTY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to connect 1,479 consumers, and build and improve 145 miles of line. This loan includes various smart grid projects in the amount of $19,114,300 including the installation of 458.23 miles of backbone fiber to bring fiber communication to all its district offices. Woodruff Electric is headquartered in Forrest City, Arkansas, and serves an average of 19,881 consumers through 4,946 miles of line in seven counties in east-central Arkansas.

funding_code: ELECTRIC FFB - OTHER
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to finance the construction of 14 solar photovoltaic (PV) facilities. The projects will be located on separate parcels of land within the state of Kansas with the output of the facilities delivered to and sold to various electric cooperatives. The total rated output of all 14 Projects will be 13,750 kWAC.

funding_code: RURAL ENERGY SAVINGS PROGRAM (RESP)
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to finance an energy efficiency relending program with projects that include HVAC replacement, LED lighting, water heater replacement, energy efficient appliances and on or off grid renewable energy systems.

funding_code: PILOT BROADBAND GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to deploy a fiber-to-the-premises network to connect 986 people, 10 businesses and 145 farms to high-speed internet in Searcy and Van Buren counties. The company will make high-speed internet affordable by offering low-cost starter packages with voice and voice/data. Discounts will be offered to those who participate in the Federal Communications Commissions Lifeline and Affordable Connectivity Programs.

funding_code: PILOT BROADBAND GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to deploy a fiber-to-the-premises network to connect 89 people, 17 farms and a business to high-speed internet in Scott County, Arkansas. Scott County Telephone Company will make high-speed internet affordable by participating in the FCCs Lifeline and Affordable Connectivity programs.

funding_code: RECONNECT 100% GRANT INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENTS AND JOBS ACT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to deploy a fiber-to-the-premises network to connect 999 people, 100 farms and 33 businesses to high-speed internet in Jefferson and Lincoln counties in Arkansas. Southwestern Bell Telephone Company will make high-speed internet affordable by participating in the FCCs Affordable Connectivity Program. This project will serve socially vulnerable communities in Jefferson and Lincoln counties in Arkansas.

funding_code: GUARANTEED B&I 3% FEE LOAN
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a sawmill, purchase and retool equipment, startup working capital, transactional costs, and loan closing costs.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY DELTA HEALTH CARE GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Other Services (except Public Administration) (81)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Winrock International address healthcare needs in four Arkansas counties in the Delta Region. The target audience will be employees, chambers of commerce, and worksites. The project will reach a key sector of the Delta population and address chronic disease burdens driven by social and economic determinants. With the goal of fostering total worker health, the project provides targeted assistance to employees, employers, clinical staff, nurses, and community health workers.

borrower_name: UNIVERSITY OF AR FOR MEDICAL SCIENCES
funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY DELTA HEALTH CARE GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Educational Services (61)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences expand their telehealth initiative. The existing Delta-based Telehealth Training Centers, located in three Arkansas cities, reaches an array of rural residents and professionals. This project will provide education about telehealth and how it can be used in an individuals life.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Arkansas Human Development Corporation provide training and technical assistance designed to start new businesses or strengthen and/or expand current businesses through job creation. Three business development forums will be offered virtually and on site in Phillips, Columbia, and Jefferson counties in Arkansas.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services (54)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Leafscape Inc. install a 23.2 kilowatt solar array. Leafscapre Inc. is a indoor landscaping company in rural Pulaski County, Arkansas. The project is expected to save $2,700 per year and replace 33,758 kilowatt hours (99 percent of the companys energy use) annually.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Community Venture Foundation, dba Startup Junkie Foundation, implement an initiative. This initiative offers resiliency resources as well as events and consulting for both new and established businesses in rural communities within Washington, Benton, Madison, Marion, Searcy, Newton, Boone, Carroll, and Baxter Counties in Arkansas.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Communities Unlimited, Inc. provide customized and intensive business and management consulting services to rural businesses in 51 Arkansas counties with a focus on minority-owned businesses.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: RENEWABLE ENERGY SYSTEMS GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
naics_description: BROILERS AND OTHER MEAT TYPE CHICKEN PRODUCTION
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Dixie Acres Inc., an agricultural producer specializing in poultry, install a 289 kilowatt (kW) solar array in Summers, Arkansas. This renewable energy project is expected to save $37,507 and generate 419,400 kilowatt hours (kWh) (100 percent of the operations historic usage) annually, which is enough energy to power 38 homes.

funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide technical assistance to seven low-income communities; three communities in Arkansas, one community in Louisiana, two communities in Mississippi and one community in Oklahoma. Communities Unlimited will develop its capacity in GIS mapping of local assets including existing environmental system infrastructure, leadership development of a comprehensive entrepreneurship ecosystem strategy to build local economies and develop and implement a broadband strategy to integrate high-speed internet access to all local beneficiaries.

funding_code: (WWA PROGRAM AREA) INDIVIDUALLY-OWNED WATER WELL SYSTEMS GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used for revolving loans to eligible individual homeowners in seven states to construct, rehabilitate, or upgrade private household water supply or wastewater systems.

project_name: Water Service to Pettigrew and the Southern Madison County Vicinity
funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used for a water extension project in southern Madison County and the Pettigrew area in order to serve an additional 688 rural residents. The extension project will include the installation of water lines, two pump stations and five water storage tanks necessary to serve these rural residents who currently do not have access to safe, potable, drinking water.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to repair the city hall metal roof, and replacie the screws and rubber O-rings to eliminate water infiltration. Additional funding includes $4,172 in applicant contribution for a total project cost of $16,172.

naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
naics_description: OTHER FIRE/RESCUE & PUBLIC SAFETY RELATED SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a police radio repeater in order to provide more reliable emergency communication for first responder and public protection and safety services to area rural residents. funding_code: TEST
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
naics_description: ADMINISTRATION OF URBAN PLANNING AND COMMUNITY AND RURAL DEVELOPMENT
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help offset the costs associated with the purchasing and installating five roof-mounted solar systems in Elaine, Arkansas. The solar project is part of a partnership between East Arkansas Planning and Development District, The City of Elaine, and two local non-profit organizations, Lee St. Community Center, and Jimmy McClain Center for Hope. The partnerships objective is to establish clean energy communities in and around the rural, economically distressed community of Elaine, Arkansas. The objective of this project is to help establish clean energy communities within Elaine and the surrounding region.

project_name: North Central Crawford Co. Water Extension
funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide funds for a water system extension to serve approximately 349 users in North Central Crawford County who currently do not have access to a potable water supply as they currently rely on private wells which are inadequate in quantity, quality or both. Many of the rural residents in this area currently rely on hauling water from a nearby source to obtain potable water.

project_name: North Central Crawford Co. Water Extension
funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide funds for a water system extension to serve approximately 349 users in North Central Crawford County who currently do not have access to a potable water supply as they currently rely on private wells which are inadequate in quantity, quality or both. Many of the rural residents in this area currently rely on hauling water from a nearby source to obtain potable water.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT UNRESTRICTED (FY 22/23)
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Adolph Pirani Corporation install a 259.2 kilowatt (kW) solar array for their agricultural operations in Marion, Arkansas. This project is expected to replace 405,963 kilowatt hours (kWh) of energy and save $53,786 annually (90 percent of historic usage), which is enough energy to power 37 homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP IRA EEI GRANT UNRESTRICTED (FY 22/23)
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Adolph Pirani Corporation, an agricultural producer, install electric irrigation pumps on 13 wells for their operations in Marion, Arkansas. This diesel to electric motor conversion project is expected to save $67,958 and 740,989 kilowatt hours (kWh) annually, which is enough electricity to power 68 homes.

funding_code: REAP IRA EEI GRANT UNRESTRICTED (FY 22/23)
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Cody Ray Askew, a cattle and swine producer in Fulton, Arkansas, replace propane cremation equipment with an electric rotary composter for managing animal mortality. This project will save $27,985 and 514,731 kilowatt hours (kWh) (99 percent of historic usage) annually, which is enough electricity to power 47 homes.

funding_code: DELTA HEALTH CARE SERVICES GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Jefferson Hospital Association renovate the Jefferson School of Nursing building in Pine Bluff, Arkansas. This project will expand the designated student space and telehealth training center, resulting in increased student capacity. The renovations also include the addition of a commercial teaching kitchen that will house and operate a food pharmacy for the Pine Bluff area. This project will provide services to eight counties in the Arkansas Delta region and is expected to assist 135 individuals and create two jobs.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY DELTA HEALTH CARE GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Jefferson Hospital Association renovate the Jefferson School of Nursing building in Pine Bluff, Arkansas. This project will expand the designated student space and telehealth training center, resulting in increased student capacity. The renovations also include the addition of a commercial teaching kitchen that will house and operate a food pharmacy for the Pine Bluff area. This project will provide services to eight counties in the Arkansas Delta region and is expected to assist 135 individuals and create two jobs.

funding_code: SECTION 306 FFB - OTHER ELECTRIC FFB - OTHER LOAN PERSISTENT POVERTY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to connect 1,646 consumers, and build and improve 178 miles of line. This loan includes $21,212,000 in smart grid technologies including 2,220 miles of fiber installation. Clay County Electric is headquartered in Corning, Arkansas, providing electric service to 13,155 consumers through 2,795 miles of line in seven counties in central Arkansas.

funding_code: SECTION 306 FFB - OTHER ELECTRIC FFB - OTHER LOAN PERSISTENT POVERTY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to connect 866 consumers, and build and improve 151 miles of line. This loan includes $4,310,800 in smart grid technologies including 161.65 miles of backbone fiber. Farmers Electric Cooperative Corporation (FECC) is headquartered in Newport, Arkansas serving approximately 5,100 members through 994 miles of line in Northeast Arkansas.

funding_code: RURAL ENERGY SAVINGS PROGRAM (RESP)
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to finance a relending program to qualified consumers who will implement energy efficiency measures. Todays Power is based in Little Rock, Arkansas.

funding_code: DISTANCE LEARNING- GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to equip four hub sites and four end-user sites throughout Stone County in northcentral Arkansas with digital learning technology. Instructors at Ozarka College in Stone County, Arkansas will deliver Culinary Arts, Auto Service Tech, Nursing, Emergency Medical Technical, Certified Nursing Assistant and Commercial Pilot Program courses to four locations benefitting 1,527 students.

funding_code: PILOT BROADBAND COST OVERRUN GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will provide additional financing to upgrade broadband service in the Alread community to fiber-to-the-premises in portions of Van Buren and Pope County, Arkansas. The funded service area includes 218 households spread over 94 square miles.

funding_code: PILOT BROADBAND COST OVERRUN GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will provide additional financing to deploy fiber-to-the-premises broadband service in rural Arkansas. The funded service area includes 554 households and three essential community facilities spread over 44 square miles.

funding_code: PILOT BROADBAND COST OVERRUN GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will provide additional financing to deploy fiber-to-the-premises broadband service in rural Arkansas. The funded service area includes 526 households spread over 69 square miles.

funding_code: GUARANTEED B&I 3% FEE LOAN
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Camden Timbers, LLC refinance debt on its sawmill located in Camden, Arkansas. As a result, the borrower will realize a lower monthly payment and increased cash flow. Camden Timbers employs more than 46 people.

funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT UNRESTRICTED (FY 22/23)
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install a 144 kilowatt (kW) solar system for Brian Stoner Farms agricultural operations in Lexa, Arkansas. This project is expected to save $17,677 annually, and generate 219,401 kilowatt hours (kWh) of electricity per year, which is enough energy to power 20 homes.

naics_description: LESSORS OF OTHER REAL ESTATE PROPERTY
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install a 48 kilowatt (kW) solar array for Sig Properties LLCs property management operations in Lexa, Arkansas. The project is expected to save $6,327 and replace 700,300 kilowatt hours (kWh) (95 percent of historic usage) annually, which is enough electricity to power 64 homes.

funding_code: RBCS DEVELOPMENT GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Winrock International identify needs and capabilities of emerging agricultural operations and facilitate access to education, business, and organizational resources. The project covers the northwest half of Arkansas with an initial concentrated focus on Montgomery, Johnson, and Sharp counties.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Arkansas Human Development Corporation provide training and technical assistance to businesses in rural communities. Three business-development forums will be held in Mississippi, Ouachita, and Sevier counties, Arkansas.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT UNRESTRICTED (FY 22/23)
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install a 37.4 kilowatt (kW) solar systemat Rusty Tractor Vineyards LLC in rural Pulaski County, Arkansas. The project annually is expected to save the business $4,780 and replace 51,850 kilowatt hours (kWh) (85 percent).

program: Rural Energy for America Technical Assistance Grant Program
funding_code: REAP IRA TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services (54)
naics_description: OTHER SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL CONSULTING SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Atlas Consulting Services provide technical assistance to rural small businesses and agricultural producers in the state of Arkansas. The outreach focus will be in distressed and disadvantaged communities. Guidance, such as application and SAM/UEI registration assistance, will be provided to potential REAP applicants. The project is expected to assist approximately 20 business owners and achieve an average of five application submissions per quarter.

program: Rural Energy for America Technical Assistance Grant Program
funding_code: REAP IRA TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services (54)
naics_description: OTHER SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL CONSULTING SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Innovation Power and Control Solutions LLC primarily assist agricultural producers in Chicot, Calhoun, and Ashley counties in Arkansas. This project includes assistance with submitting REAP applications, preparing technical and environmental reports, and educating producers on commercially available energy saving options for their operations. As a result of this project, it is expected that approximately 20 business owners will be assisted.

program: Rural Energy for America Technical Assistance Grant Program
funding_code: REAP IRA TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services (54)
naics_description: ALL OTHER PROFESSIONAL, SCIENTIFIC, AND TECHNICAL SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Rural Energy Alliance LLC provide guidance and support to agricultural producers and rural small businesses in Arkansas. The project will include assisting with the preparation and submission of REAP applications, conducting energy assessments and audits, preparing technical reports, and promoting the adoption of renewable energy technologies. The target focus areas will be Distressed and Disadvantaged Communities in the state. This project is expected to assist at least 30 REAP applicants through the application process.

funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide funds to Winrock International to give them the opportunity to provide technical training and assistance to four recipient communities over a 36-month term. The primary goal of this technical assistance and training will be to help develop the capacity of recipients to conduct community development programs and initiatives and increase their access to alternative funding sources.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help provide technical assistance and training to small businesses in Lee, Monroe, Phillips, and St. Francis counties, Arkansas. The project includes business planning, financial budgeting and management, business audits and recordkeeping, personnel management, and marketing for business owners and operators.

program: Rural Energy for America Technical Assistance Grant Program
funding_code: REAP IRA TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services (54)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Ecology Action of Santa Cruz provide REAP application assistance to rural small businesses in Arkansas. Priority will be focused on independently owned grocery store owners in distressed and disadvantaged communities. This project is expected to result in the facilitation of ten applications for individual store owners in the state. Through a reduction in operating costs, store owners could also expect to save up to ten jobs.

program: Rural Energy for America Technical Assistance Grant Program
funding_code: REAP IRA TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services (54)
naics_description: OTHER SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL CONSULTING SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help EIM, LLC provide technical assistance to rural small business owners and agricultural producers. Assistance will include preparing and submitting applications for REAP funding while targeting requests of $20,000 or less, underutilized technologies, and projects in distressed communities in Arkansas. This project is expected to assist more than 30 business owners.

naics_description: OTHER FIRE/RESCUE & PUBLIC SAFETY RELATED SERVICES

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help launch and fulfill an initiative to assist rural communities in nine counties of Northwest Arkansas. The project will provide one-on-one technical assistance and education in business development and expansion to entrepreneurs in these rural communities.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide technical assistance to 35 small businesses in 52 Mississippi counties. The technical assistance will include but not be limited to cash flow and financial statement management; bookkeeping and accounting systems set-up and use; social media and digital marketing strategies; feasibility studies; business plans; and turnaround strategies.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help provide customized and intensive business and management consulting services to rural businesses in 51 Arkansas counties. The project will focus on minority-owned businesses.

funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide funds to Communities Unlimited Inc. in order to give them the opportunity to provide technical training and assistance to 11 recipient communities over a 36-month term. The primary goal of this technical assistance and training will be to build the local leadership capacity of rural and under-resourced areas so that they can move their communities toward sustainable prosperity.

funding_code: CY 2022 TAT GRANTS DIV N
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide funds to Communities Unlimited Inc. in order to give them the opportunity to provide technical training and assistance to 40 communities over a 36-month term. The primary recipients of the technical training and assistance will be communities that are 2,500 or under in population and less than 60 percent of the State Non-Metropolitan median household income.

funding_code: (WWA PROGRAM AREA) INDIVIDUALLY-OWNED WATER WELL SYSTEMS GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to make loans to eligible individual homeowners primarily in its seven state target market to construct, rehabilitate or upgrade private household water supply or wastewater systems. Additionally, Communities Unlimited (CU) will work with Rural Community Assistance Partnership (RCAP) to make these loans available to qualified households in the Midwest, East and South U.S.

funding_code: (WWA PROGRAM AREA) REVOLVING LOAN FUND PROGRAM GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to make loans to eligible rural water and wastewater systems under the grantees revolving loan fund for pre-development costs and short-term costs for replacement equipment and small-scale capital projects.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP IRA EEI GRANT UNRESTRICTED (FY 22/23)
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install a drying system to the grain bins at Double Mac Farms, an agricultural producer in Griffithville, Arkansas. The project annually is expected to save the business $5,870 and replace 91,905 kilowatt hours (kWh), enough energy to power eight homes.

funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to finance improvements to the existing wastewater collection system. The wastewater system is jointly owned and operated by the city of Cotter and the city of Gassville. The primary purpose of the project is to make improvements to the jointly owned system in order to address health and sanitary standards. Additional funding in the amount of $2,196,000 is needed in connection with a recent bid overrun. These additional funds will be used in conjunction with the original funding for the project in the amount of $2,170,000 in order for the necessary improvements to be made.

project_name: North Central Crawford Co. Water Extension
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide additional funding to the city of Mountainburg, Arkansas, to cover expenses on their ongoing water system extension project. Many residents currently rely on private wells which are inadequate in water quantity and quality; many of the areas rural residents currently rely on hauling potable water from a nearby water source. The new extension will improve the water quality and quantity for approximately 313 new users in rural Crawford County who currently who do not have access to potable water.

funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT $20K AND LESS (FY 23)
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 25.6-kilowatt (kW) solar array on the ranch of Jeffrey M. Brown. funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install an early warning storm siren system for the town of Franklin. The system will provide the rural towns 198 residents with more reliable early warning notification services regarding severe weather or other emergency events. The new system modernizes the emergency notification process and allows the town to better connect with county and state emergency services.

naics_description: LESSORS OF OTHER REAL ESTATE PROPERTY
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Batteau Blackwood Farms LLC install a 54 kilowatt (kW) solar array for one of their rental properties. The system will be installed on a property that is being rented to a commercial manufacturing operation in Witter, Arkansas. This project is expected to save $5,083 and replace 68,809 kilowatt hours (kWh) (122 percent of historic usage) annually.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT UNRESTRICTED (FY 22/23)
naics_industry_sector: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing (53)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Ink Properties LLC retrofit an existing renewable energy system. This solar photovoltaic upgrade project includes the installation of new inverters and batteries for a rental cabin in Harriet, Arkansas. The discontinued use of a generator will save 2,282 gallons of propane annually, or $5,431 per summary of propane use.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Curtiss Scott, a poultry producer, install a 32 kilowatt (kW) solar array for his poultry operations in Cave City, Arkansas. This project is expected to replace 46,772 kilowatt hours (kWh) annually (73 percent of historic usage) and save $4,958 per year in energy costs.
